thread.title: NFL denies DeAngelo Williams’ request to wear pink all season long
thread.title_full: NFL denies DeAngelo Williams’ request to wear pink all season long

title: NFL denies DeAngelo Williams’ request to wear pink all season long
text:
Pa. State Trooper brightens day of boy battling brain cancer 
"He told me no. I'm assuming they are telling everybody else no as well. ... It wasn't about selling it. You know and I know and everybody else knows before I made the phone call,” Williams said, according to ESPN . 
Williams -- who lost his mother, Sandra Hill, to breast cancer in 2014 when she was just 53 years old -- instead dyed the tips of his hair pink. This is dedicated to my mom, my aunts & women everywhere affected by Breast Cancer. I love you. #WeAreInThisTogether https://t.co/bAwaanlfzV — DeAngelo Williams (@DeAngeloRB) October 11, 2015 
And in honor of his mother, Williams said he’s purchasing 53 mammogram tests for women in Charlotte (where he played for nine seasons) and in Pittsburgh. 
Williams told ESPN’s Lisa Salters : "It's not just about October for me; it's not just a month, it's a lifestyle. It's about getting women to recognize to get tested." Sign up for our WPXI-TV Sports Newsletter Sign Up
